    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Interlocutor</h1>Interlocutors are the most talented surgeon-sculptors of the velstracs, carving away flesh and replacing it with new body parts of muscle, sinew, and metal. Few interlocutors resemble one another, but all are towering, multi-limbed amalgamations of the strongest limbs, densest bone, and sharpest metal they can find. They continually search for new material to graft to their forms, and their slain foes are rarely found intact, as little is more valuable to interlocutors than a powerful opponent’s legs, eyes, or even brain.<br /><br /> Interlocutors average 9 feet tall and weigh approximately 800 pounds.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Fiend</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 32<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=462">Interlocutor</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 12</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Velstrac_Interlocutor.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Velstrac_Interlocutor.png"></a><span alt="Uncommon Trait" class="traituncommon" title="Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can’t be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=159">Uncommon</a></span><span alt="Lawful Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Lawful Evil">LE</span><span alt="Large" class="traitsize" title="Large">Large</span><span alt="Fiend Trait" class="trait" title="Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the evil-aligned planes are called fiends. Fiends can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=70">Fiend</a></span><span alt="Velstrac Trait" class="trait" title="<i>Note from Nethys: no description was provided for this trait</i>"><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=265">Velstrac</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01zrs?Pathfinder-Adventure-Path-147-Tomorrow-Must-Burn" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #147: Tomorrow Must Burn pg. 84</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +24; darkvision, painsight<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=19"><u>Infernal</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=21"><u>Shadowtongue</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +25, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4"><u>Crafting</a></u> +22 (+24 for sculpting flesh), <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +25, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=9"><u>Medicine</a></u> +26, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13"><u>Religion</a></u> +22, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +19, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=8"><u>Torture Lore</a></u> +20<br /><b>Str</b> +7, <b>Dex</b> +3, <b>Con</b> +5, <b>Int</b> +2, <b>Wis</b> +6, <b>Cha</b> +5<br /><b>Painsight</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=47">divination</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=48">divine</a>) An interlocutor automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9">doomed</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=11">dying</a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=42">wounded</a> conditions, as well as the value of those conditions.<hr /><b>AC</b> 33, <b>Fort</b> +23, <b>Ref</b> +21, <b>Will</b> +26; +1 status to all saves vs. magic<br /><b>HP</b> 215, regeneration 20 (deactivated by good or silver); <b>Immunities</b> cold; <b>Weaknesses</b> good 15, silver 15<br /><b>Unnerving Gaze</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=48">divine</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=61">enchantment</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=106">mental</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=163">visual</a>) 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it sees pieces of its own body amid the interlocutor's form. The creature must succeed at a DC 29 Will save or become <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=36">stunned 1</a>.<br /><b>Attack of Opportunity</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"><hr /><b>Speed</b> 40 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> claw +25 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=174"><u>deadly 2d10</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 3d10+13 slashing plus 2d6 persistent bleed</span><b>Divine Innate Spells</b> DC 33; <b>7th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=222">plane shift</a></u></i> (self only, to the Material or Shadow Plane only); <b>5th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=29">breath of life</a></u></i>; <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=148">heal</a></u></i> (x2), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=258">restoration</a></u></i> (x2); <b>Cantrips</b> <b>(6th)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=307">stabilize</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Focus Gaze</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32"><u>concentrate</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=61"><u>enchantment</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=106"><u>mental</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=163"><u>visual</a></u>) The interlocutor stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Will save against the interlocutor’s unnerving gaze. In addition, if the creature was already <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=36">stunned</a>, on a failed save, it feels its muscles and organs twitch and writhe, causing it to be <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=3">clumsy 2</a> for 1 minute. After attempting this save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the interlocutor’s next turn. </span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Surgical Rend</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  This functions as the Rend ability, dealing claw damage. In addition, if the target is a living creature with organs and muscle, the interlocutor opens a precise wound. Until the creature is restored to its maximum Hit Points, closing the wound, Strikes against the creature deal 1d6 extra precision damage.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=111">Velstrac</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=460">Augur</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=461">Evangelist</a></td><td>6</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=462">Interlocutor</a></td><td>12</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=463">Precentor</a></td><td>16</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=111">Velstrac</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01zrs?Pathfinder-Adventure-Path-147-Tomorrow-Must-Burn" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #147: Tomorrow Must Burn pg. 82</i></a><br />Velstracs are horrific, shadow-dwelling fiends who seek ultimate sensation through self-mutilation. They transcend their stoic detachment only when inflicting pain and terror upon their victims, practicing new forms of debasement and torture before then turning their knives on themselves. Although velstracs consider themselves beyond such limitations as morality or mortal taboos, their victims know them as emotionless tormentors who inflict debased, sadistic suffering. They claim to seek perfection in thought, form, and action, although they don’t recognize any refinement that doesn’t require the painful excision of the flesh or spirit.<br /><br /> Velstracs manifest from the souls of masochistic or sadistic mortals that are diverted into the Shadow Plane and then forged into forms that suit their vile predilections, ranging from the low-ranking augurs to the aesthetics-obsessed interlocutors.<br /><br /> Some mortals refer to velstracs as “kytons,” a misattribution that the velstracs tolerate with cold amusement. The term “kyton” denotes a master or virtuoso among their kind, and these fiends enjoy being labeled masters of their horrid paths to perfection through agony.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Despicable Origins</h3>Velstracs originated with the first debased thoughts of mortals, which the gods found so deplorable that they locked all velstracs away in Hell. It wasn’t long, however, before the newly formed race of velstracs escaped their infernal prison to the Shadow Plane.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Velstracs</h3>Scholars grimly joke that there are as many different kinds of velstracs as there are ways to skin a cat. The relatively diminutive cantor velstrac poisons the minds of its victims so that they believe they are being clawed from the inside out. The mighty eremites, on the other hand, seek out the most powerful beings to subsume into their own form and lord over all other velstracs save the demagogues.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> The Shadow Forge</h3>Many velstracs forge their own chains, but others outsource the task to unique velstracs known as almoners. These blind, deaf, and mute velstracs resemble six-armed halflings severed at the waist that toil away endlessly at a great burning foundry called the Shadow Forge. Almoners operate under mysterious strictures, and are just as likely to turn a velstrac away empty-handed as they are to hand one a finely crafted chain before the request has even been uttered.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Velstrac Divinities</h3>The most powerful velstracs are unique divinities known collectively as demagogues—powerful creatures often worshipped by mortals who seek to experience agonizing new revelations and gain power by enhancing the body through pain.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
